summary: The Semiquincentennial Tourism and Access to Recreation Sites Act (STARS Act) directs the Secretary of the Interior to designate September 17, 2026, as a fee-free day at National Park System units to celebrate the 250th anniversary of the United States. It mandates waivers of entrance fees and standard amenity recreation fees at various public recreational sites managed by the National Park Service, Bureau of Land Management, Bureau of Reclamation, and Forest Service on that date.
